primary_trope.hook_text: Only a handful of races score 5/5 on Adventure. Gravel Burn is one.
primary_trope.mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) — knowing a perfect score exists but not why triggers dopamine anticipation.

beats.label: HOOK + PROMISE
beats.narration: Should you race Gravel Burn? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. Gravel Burn scored 70 out of 100. Elite tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.
beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Gravel Burn. Mpumalanga, South Africa. 62 mi. 100 km, 2.5 thousand m. 85% gravel, 15% dirt. South African highveld. rolling red dirt roads. Technical rating: 3/5.
beats.text_on_screen: Gravel Burn | Mpumalanga, South Africa | 62 mi
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: The numbers. All fourteen of them. Adventure. 5 out of 5. Adventure is the entire point. Riding through Big Five territory in fossil-rich semi-desert where 'the hardiest creatures thrive' maxes the adventure meter. Experience. 5 out of 5. This race ruins other races for you. The Burn Camps create 'camaraderie, storytelling, and shared adventure' with communal campfires and local cultural integration including live music and regional cuisine. Value. 5 out of 5. Dollar for dollar, one of the best in gravel. Seven days, 800km, full-service Burn Camps, wildlife encounters, and airport transport options – this is expedition-level experience for stage race entry fees. Elevation. 4 out of 5. Serious elevation. Train your climbing legs. 11,000m of climbing over 800km creates serious vertical density across South Africa's most dramatic landscapes. Prestige. 4 out of 5. Top-shelf reputation. Calendar priority. Race Quality. 4 out of 5. Premium race experience. Full-service Burn Camps with two-night stays show they're not messing around with logistics and rider care. Community. 4 out of 5. Riders come for the race. Stay for the people. Length. 3 out of 5. Long enough to matter. Short enough to recover. Seven stages of 90-140km each totaling 800km pushes most riders past their comfort zone without crossing into masochism.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: The rest, in rapid succession. Technicality. 3 out of 5. Technical enough to thin the pack. Field Depth. 3 out of 5. Deep enough to push you. Expenses. 3 out of 5. Mid-range expenses. Budget a proper race weekend. Logistics. 2 out of 5. Functional. Not impressive. Climate. 2 out of 5. Mostly pleasant. Check the forecast anyway. Altitude. 2 out of 5. Not enough altitude to blame for your pace.

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: South African Red Dirt Adventure. If you've never done a multi-day gravel event, this isn't where you start. the Karoo semi-desert doesn't forgive poor pacing or inadequate hydration systems. You need solid base fitness for 100km+ daily efforts and the mental fortitude for a week of accumulating fatigue. The full-service camps cushion the suffering, but those long drags to places like Conical Peak will expose fitness gaps quickly.
beats.editing_note: CLOSE THE MAIN LOOP. 0.5s silence before verdict. Tier badge slams in. Avatar delivers final take. DO NOT signal 'wrapping up' — maintain energy.

beats.label: ALTERNATIVES
beats.narration: If Gravel Burn isn't quite right for you. Cape Epic offers similar South African adventure with better-established logistics and stronger international field. For stage race experience without the travel, consider Gravel Worlds' multi-day format or Trans Iowa if you want proper suffering without the safari marketing.
beats.editing_note: Bonus value — viewers who reach this point are highly engaged. Cross-reference other videos/races.
